caption.title: High Risk Allergy areas in Europe
caption.p: High allergy risk’ (HAR) areas of common ragweed A. artemisiifolia) (A–C), perennial ragweed ( A. psilostachya) (D–F) and giant ragweed ( A. trifida) (G–I) in Europe under current climate conditions, and projected future climates (for years 2070–2099) under RCP 6.0 and RCP 8.5. Letters indicate locations of major cities (a, Madrid; b, London; c, Paris; d, Hamburg; e, Rome; f, Berlin; g, Vienna; h, Bucharest; i, Istanbul; j, Saint Petersburg).
Click here for additional data file.
